page.title: 15MOORLAND
page.content:
There used to be a lot of trees on the surrounding moors, but now there are only a few small ones left because the others have been chopped down by the striking miners who needed the wood for fuel in the cold winter months of last year. Moorends is not one of the most picturesque villages I have ever seen, but I would not live anywhere else.
{THORNE MOORS.} Thorne moors was once peatland covering thousands of acres known as Inclesmoor. Today, after being reduced by reclamation for farmland and exploited by Fisons for it's peat, it covers an area of about 5,250 acres. The area is roughly bounded by Goole, Crowle and Thorne and is divided by parish boundaries so that each share has a name e.g.Crowle Moor,
